isometricviewv2

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • isometricviewv2.Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    OVERVIEW: this class holds two arrays that essentially make up what is our field of view, simply named a "map". The first array mapSize is the size of the viewable grid while the second array dataSize is the maximum size of the tile data that can be stored. This class is also responsible for limiting player movement in certain cases (clipping) and the loading, saving and rendering of tile images to the screen.

      REQUIRES: the size of the visible grid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(int size)
        REQUIRES: the size of the visible grid. EFFECTS: instantiates the 6 important variables below. Some are simply constants defined by myself and one in particular uses the output of a function to instantiate itself as a [dataSize x dataSize] array.
        Parameters:
        size - the side length of the visible grid. Select a smaller number for a smaller visible map, and vice versa.

    • Method Detail

      • loadMapData

        public Tile[][] loadMapData()
        REQUIRES: a text file at ../config/map.dat. EFFECTS: loads a [dataSize x dataSize] array into memory using values from a text file and passes this array back to the instance variable "tiles".
        Returns:
        a 2 dimensional array of type Tile containing the map information

      • saveMapData

        public void saveMapData(Tile[][] tiles)
        REQUIRES: a [dataSize x dataSize] array of information in a format suitable for saving to a text file. EFFECTS: saves this map data into a text file.
        Parameters:
        tiles - a 2 dimensional array of type Tile containing the map information

      • loadPlayerImages

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] loadPlayerImages()
        REQUIRES: an image file at ../images/player.png. EFFECTS: loads the image file into memory then cuts it into four parts. Each sub image represents the player facing in a different direction.
        Returns:
        an array of type BufferedImage holding the player's look while facing four different directions

      • loadTileImages

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] loadTileImages()
        REQUIRES: an image file at ../images/tiles.png. EFFECTS: loads the image file into memory then cuts it into (width of picture) / 40 pixels since each tile should be 40 pixels in length. Each sub image represents a different type of tile.
        Returns:
        an array of type BufferedImage containing images that represent one of 46 different tiles

      • drawScene

        public void drawScene(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                      java.awt.Graphics g,
                      java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] tileImages,
                      java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] playerImages,
                      Entity player)
        REQUIRES: a jPanel to draw on, a graphics context to draw with, the sub images representing both tiles and the player, as well as the entity instance holding player information. Objects cannot be null. EFFECTS: draws the entire scene, tile by tile in top to bottom order so the tiles are overlapping in the correct order. Also draws the player once it encounters the specific tile the player is drawn on. Also draws "soil tiles" underneath any floating tiles. MODIFIES: this function draws on the jPanel, rendering it permanently changed. No other changes are made to input objects.
        Parameters:
        panel - a JPanel to draw on
        g - a Graphics context to draw with
        tileImages - the set of sub-images that represent all possible tiles
        playerImages - the set of sub-images that represent all faced directions for the player
        player - the Entity instance that represents the player

      • drawPlayer

        public void drawPlayer(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                       java.awt.Graphics g,
                       java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] playerImages,
                       Entity player)
        REQUIRES: jPanel to draw on, graphics context to draw with, a set of images representing the player and the entity instance holding the player's information. Objects cannot be null. EFFECTS: draws the player's current avatar at the player's current position on the grid.
        Parameters:
        panel - a JPanel to draw on
        g - a Graphics context to draw with
        playerImages - the set of sub-images that represent all faced directions for the player
        player - the Entity instance that represents the player

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        EFFECTS: returns map size.
        Returns:
        mapSize the side length of the visible grid

      • getDataSize

        public int getDataSize()
        EFFECTS: returns map data size.
        Returns:
        mapSize the number of rows (or columns) that the data size array contains

      • getMapData

        public Tile[][] getMapData()
        EFFECTS: returns [dataSize x dataSize] array of tile information.
        Returns:
        a 2 dimensional array containing the map's tile data

      • changeOffsetX

        public void changeOffsetX(boolean increase)
        REQUIRES: a boolean value. If true, increases X offset. Otherwise, decreases X offset. EFFECTS: used to change offset after the player has walked towards the edge of walkable map.
        Parameters:
        increase - if true, increases the offset and otherwise, decreases the offset.

      • changeOffsetY

        public void changeOffsetY(boolean increase)
        REQUIRES: a boolean value. If true, increases Y offset. Otherwise, decreases Y offset. EFFECTS: used to change offset after the player has walked towards the edge of walkable map.
        Parameters:
        increase - if true, increases the offset and otherwise, decreases the offset.

      • getOffsetX

        public int getOffsetX()
        EFFECTS: returns X offset value.
        Returns:
        the x coordinate of the map offset

      • getOffsetY

        public int getOffsetY()
        EFFECTS: returns Y offset value.
        Returns:
        the y coordinate of the map offset

      • switchClipping

        public void switchClipping()
        EFFECTS: if clipping is disabled, enable it. If clipping is conversely enabled, disable it.

      • clipping

        public boolean clipping()
        EFFECTS: returns true if clipping is enabled, and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if clipping is enabled, and false otherwise

      • usingDebug

        public boolean usingDebug()
        EFFECTS: returns true if debugging mode is enabled, and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if debugging mode is on, and otherwise false

      • switchDebug

        public void switchDebug()
        EFFECTS: if debugging mode is enabled, disable it. Conversely, if debugging mode is disabled, enable it.
